com.amazon.insights
Interface ABTestClient

public interface ABTestClient

ABTestClient is the entry point into the Amazon Insights SDK where variations are retrieved for projects.

Allocation Example

The example below demonstrates how to allocate a variation for a specific project. Once a variation is received, the developer obtains the variables of the variation to vary the behavior. In this example, the developer is requesting a variation for level 1 to see if varying the buy message text in the game increases in app purchases. Example: 
 // allocate/obtain variations for level 1 

 final InsightsHandler<VariationSet> handler = insightsInstance.getABTestClient().getVariations("Level1Revenue");
 handler.setCallback(new InsightsCallback<VariationSet>() {
     public void onComplete(final VariationSet variations) {
         final Variation revenueVariation = variations.getVariation("Level1Revenue");
         
         // get the revenue variation for this user and access the message to display to user when it's time to buy
         final String buyNowMessage = revenueVariation.getVariableAsString("buyMessage", "Upgrade your character?");
         
         // Use the buyNowMessage as required in the application
     }
 });

Method Summary
 InsightsHandler<VariationSet> getVariations(java.lang.String... projectNames)
          Returns a InsightsHandler<VariationSet> object that accepts an InsightsCallback to receive the VariationSet containing the Variations requested.
 

Method Detail

getVariations

InsightsHandler<VariationSet> getVariations(java.lang.String... projectNames)
Returns a InsightsHandler<VariationSet> object that accepts an InsightsCallback to receive the VariationSet containing the Variations requested.

This method returns immediately, even though all requested Variations have not been obtained. The request will be performed in a background thread and will not block the calling thread. The returned InsightsHandler<VariationSet> should be utilized to register an InsightsCallback that will receive the VariationSet served for the request.

Parameters:
projectNames - All projects that a variation should be allocated for.
Returns:
A InsightsHandler<VariationSet> object used to register an InsightsCallback.
